inclusion.criterion: spinal cord injury, multiple sclerosis, transverse myelitis or cauda equina damage
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of spinal pathology for at least 12 months
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: no significant changes in underlying condition for 12 weeks
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: living in the community (not in residential care)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient is presenting to the hospital

inclusion.criterion: at least three urinary tract infection episodes treated using anti-biotics over preceding 12 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing to use contraception for the duration of the study (if woman of child-bearing age)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: having mental capacity to give informed consent
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: surgical alterations to the bladder, excluding supra-pubic catherisation
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: known hypersensitivity to the active principle or to any of the excipients of Uro-Vaxom®
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: unwilling to take a product containing gelatin (e.g. vegetarians)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: recruitment can be postponed until antibiotics have not been used for a period of 14 days and symptoms of a UTI have subsided
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient has had multiple prior admissions for UTIs

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter, and recurrent UTIs. The patient's condition may not be suitable for the study due to the presence of a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter.
